thread.title: Slidell students arrested for alleged social media threats
thread.title_full: Slidell students arrested for alleged social media threats - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: Kelly Weston, Digital Content Producer
title: Slidell students arrested for alleged social media threats
text:
SLIDELL, LA (WVUE) - Two Slidell students, ages 13 and 14, were arrested Monday after investigators said they threatened other students via social media over the weekend, according to the St. Tammany Parish Sheriff’s Office.
Deputies were called to Clearwood Junior High School on Monday to investigate the threats, which initially involved two students threatening three other students, but escalated to include the use of guns, the sheriff’s office said.
Investigators obtained copies of the posts and met with the five students and their parents. The students, their book bags and their lockers were all searched, and no weapons were found at the school. Two pellet guns were recovered from a home where the students admitted placing them.
The two juveniles who allegedly made the threats were arrested for aggravated assault and released into the custody of their parents.
The incident is still under investigation, and the Sheriff's Office is working closely with the St. Tammany Parish School System to resolve the issue.
